results.title: Lenses
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, S.G. Fergusson, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Light”.
Convex lens as a collection of prism sections; images formed by convex lens; applications of the various object/image arrangement; effect of increased curvature; concave lens; images formed by a concave lens.

results.title: Lenses
results.brief_description: Explains phases of lense refraction, and by animation shows action of a converging lense, real and virtual images, changes of magnification; effect of a diverging lense, and formation of the virtual image; and construction of achromatic lenses. Silent film with English subtext.

results.title: Lennon: a tribute
results.creator_credit: Philip Chilvers, Ian Bolt, John Lennon Tribute Ltd and Gavin Taylor
results.brief_description: John Lennon was one of the most talented and prolific songwriters of our time. His music is as timeless and relevant today as it was a generation ago. His songs revolutionised our music and culture. In this unique tribute to Lennon, over 23 of the world’s greatest performers bring a little bit of magic to Lennon’s songs as they perform their own interpretations of his classics. From Lenny Kravitz singing “Cold Turkey” to Hall and Oates singing “Don’t let me down” to Elton John performing “Imagine” we are moved by the strength of the emotions Lennon’s words still evoke today. Hosted by Michael Douglas, these memorable songs are intercut with rare archival footage of John Lennon and The Beatles.

results.title: Leningradskaya: a village in southern Russia
results.creator_credit: Tom Roberts, John Walker, BBC and October Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Hand of Stalin”.
In 1929, Stalin implemented a massive process of forced farm collectivisation which saw millions of peasants forcibly removed from their land. Ill-conceived and carelessly administered, the collectivisation process resulted in millions of peasants suffering deportation, imprisonment and finally death by starvation as the process led to a massive famine. Interviews with peasants, old Communist Party activists and survivors of the famine provide an eloquent and moving testament to the abuse of power enacted by Stalin in his iron-willed determination to make collectivisation a success.

results.title: Leningrad
results.creator_credit: John Walker, Tom Roberts, Angus MacQueen, BBC and October Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Hand of Stalin”.
In the 1930s Stalin consolidated his power by creating a strict heirarchical level of command which depended upon paranoia and authoritarian repression for success. Millions of people were accused of “crimes against the state” and forced to sign confessions in show trials which only added to the growing societal hysteria. In interviews with both survivors and administrators of the “purges”, we see how the use of informers and the secret police led to a social order of mistrust where neigbour turned on neighbour and sibling on sibling. Filmed in the old city of Leningrad this powerful documentary shows how the purges, with their subsequant tortures, imprisonments and violence are still the cause of deep anguish for contemporary Russians.

results.title: Lenin and Trotsky
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Shows how Lenin and Trotsky made possible the seizure of the Russian Government and the consolidation of Communist power in the USSR, and how Lenin became a Communist hero, while Trotsky became the arch-enemy. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Lenin's secret files
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Time watch”.
‘Lenin’s secret files’ is part of an acclaimed investigative history series from the BBC which pursues new evidence and research of familiar historical events and figures. In this program the ethnic background, family, political ruthlessness and illness of Vladimir Illich Lenin, who, in 1917 led the Russian Revolution, are followed. It uses the personal archives of Lenin - which have only been accessible since the collapse of communism, to present a definitive portrait of one of history’s key figures.

results.title: Lenin's Russia
results.creator_credit: Richard Dunn and Educational Media International
results.brief_description: This film adopts a novel approach to Lenin’s Russia by using a debate between two university students on the use of book and film resources to investigate the period. The film includes authentic newsreel footage. It is involved in examining problems of historical methodology. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Lenin's revolution
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the background to the Russian revolution of 1917, Lenin’s intentions and policies and the consolidation of the Bolsheviks in power. Commentary by Brian Redhead. Suitable for upper secondary level.
